snippet: The National Security Agency finds itself under intense pressure after disclosures of spying on allies and rivals alike, but it defends the wide net it casts.
abstract: Picture of the National Security Agency that emerges from thousands of classified documents is one of an electronic omnivore of staggering capabilities; data shows that NSA has eavesdropped and hacked its way around the world to strip governments and other targets of their secrets, routinely spying on friends as well as foes.
lead_paragraph: The National Security Agency finds itself under intense pressure after disclosures of spying on allies and rivals alike, but it defends the wide net it casts.

headline.sub: An Ethos of ‘Why Not?’ at American Spy Agency
headline.main: No Morsel Too Minuscule for All-Consuming N.S.A.
headline.print_headline: No Morsel Too Minuscule For All-Consuming N.S.A.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
